description: I get the hype but it is a just misses for me.

title: An absolut...
description: An absolute hit at game night. An easy game to get anyone into and doesn't require a lot of setup or explanation. Hits the table with regularity.

title: Fantastic ...
description: Fantastic family / gathering game. Low entry bar. You may have to swap some words if the kids are the agents and don't know the words. Maybe look into one of the picture variants for younger kids.

title: This game ...
description: This game is excellent.  Seems so far to have great replayability, it's a simple game, but it lets you try to think out of the box and get on a wavelength with your partner.  So far I'm loving it.  Don't know how it will hold up over time, but it's quickly shot up my play list and I'm always happy to bring it out some more.The only real hinkiness in the rules is the whole part about keeping a straight face, and not giving anything away.  Of course it's essential to play a straight game, but it's hard not to high five your partner if he gets what you were trying to go for on something brilliant.

title: Rating bas...
description: Rating based on 1st plays with 3 players. Is probably much better with more, but this wll probably not get much playtime so willing to trade this away.

title: Great part...
description: Great party game.  Played with 4 players.

title: You really...
description: You really don't need the commercial version to play this game, just a set of cards/tiles with random words or pictures. The presentation is nice though and cheap enough for those who don't want to make a homebrew version by combining cards from another game and one of the many websites or apps that generate spymaster keys.

title: The most f...
description: The most fun I've game with any game with my entire family. This is a huge success and I expect this game will stay in my collection forever.

title: Amazingly ...
description:
Amazingly simple premise, but loads of fun!
Similar to the classic game Password, but with a spy theme and possibility that you could inadvertently help out the other team. Seriously, if you don't know anything about this game, find out now. Just go play it.

title: Easy to te...
description: Easy to teach game but it is easy to get burned out on it for me.

title: awesome pa...
description: awesome party game.  I like the word association in this game and trying to guess or make a clue that ties to multiple words.  I feel that it is best with 4 players where there are teams of 2, I don't like discussing with your teammates.

title: Best Party...
description: Best Partygame for groups that dont usually play games. Gets repetitive after 10 or so plays :) But worth until it gets to that point.

title: What to sa...
description: What to say? It's a worldwide hit! One of the easiest games to introduce to new players - experienced or not. Rules are dead simple, and the gameplay is great.

title: I played t...
description: I played this at a church game night with five players who I would not consider "gamers". We wound up playing about 10 games in a row until people had to start leaving. Everyone had a blast! I've also played it with my game group (it was a friend's copy) and the three of us that didn't own it, ordered it immediately. This game is fun with just about anyone, definitely one of the first I would reach for to play with non-gamers but I also wouldn't hesitate to bring it out with hardcore hobbyists either.

title: Fun and in...
description:
Fun and inventive. That said, it has some strikes against it:
-I don't like team-based games where one person does most of the heavy lifting, and
-When it comes to having lots of people, I generally prefer lying to them.
